Module com.example.sudoku
Package com.example.sudoku.model

Class Board

java.lang.Object
com.example.sudoku.model.Board
public class Board extends Object
Represents a 6x6 Sudoku board with logic for generation, validation, and gameplay operations. Handles full solution generation, clearing cells for the puzzle, input validation, and player assistance.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Default constructor.

  • Method Details

    • generateBoard

      public void generateBoard()
      Initializes the board with a valid complete solution using backtracking.

    • clearCells

      public void clearCells(int count)
      Removes a specific number of cells from the board to create the puzzle. The remaining cells retain their correct solution values.
      Parameters:
      count - Number of cells to clear randomly.

    • getValues

      public int[][] getValues()
      Retrieves the current values on the board.
      Returns:
      A 2D array of integers representing the values of all cells.

    • setValue

      public void setValue(int row, int col, int value)
      Sets a value into the board at the specified position if the cell is editable.
      Parameters:
      row - Row index.
      col - Column index.
      value - Value to assign to the cell.

    • revealOneCell

      public boolean revealOneCell()
      Reveals a single valid value in a random empty cell by attempting valid options. Does not use the original solution, only random valid values based on current state.
      Returns:
      true if a cell was revealed, false if no valid cell could be found.

    • isComplete

      public boolean isComplete()
      Verifies if the current board is completely filled and valid.
      Returns:
      true if the board is complete and correct, false otherwise.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the board by generating a new solution and clearing random cells. Default number of cleared cells: 14.

    • solve

      public boolean solve(int row, int col)
      Solves the board completely using recursive backtracking.
      Parameters:
      row - Starting row index.
      col - Starting column index.
      Returns:
      true if a solution was found, false otherwise.

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid(int row, int col, int value)
      Validates if placing a specific value in a cell is allowed by Sudoku rules: - No duplicates in the row - No duplicates in the column - No duplicates in the 2x3 region
      Parameters:
      row - Row index.
      col - Column index.
      value - Value to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the value is valid, false otherwise.
